TopicTitle: Max Physics Delta Time per Frame

Articles.Content:
This is a workaround increase performance.

The issue is the max physics delta time per frame is being changed when using physics time warp and not returning to the value set on the main menu settings page.

Use physics time warp to increase performance. At 2x there is some increase but at 4x the increase nearly doubles.

The performance increase physics time warp alters and increases the MPDTF to a value less then 0.03 at normal 1x warp and the game is stable and remains changed after physics time warp returns to normal.

Switching vessels or returning to KSC does not change performance and reloading from saves needs testing MPDTF and resetting the value on the main menu settings page will reset the max physics delta time per frame.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

edit:

This is the work around to prevent alteration of or reset the max physics delta time per frame.

After testing it seems this is a bug because the value for max physics delta time per frame is being altered and can only be avoided if the user never physics time warp. To reset the value it must be done from the main menu.

To prevent max physics delta time per frame from being altered the physics time warp can never be used or use 0.08 for the MPDTF.

If the physics time warp is used the user would have to return to the main menu and change the value and apply and change it back to the desired level and accept.

I have tested on a stock version KSP 1.0.4 with similar results.

edit2:

The KerboKatz SmallUtilities can easily demonstrate this bug. Any value lower than 0.08 for the Max Physics Delta Time per Frame will be increased after using physics time warp.

The value for the Max Physics Delta Time per Frame is located just to the right of the MET
